*Subject for 9/1/19: *WORSHIP THE LIVING GOD (Ps. read 135:1-4)



*Verse for Today:*

*Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord! Praise Him, *

*you who serve in the house of the Lord, in the courts of*

*the house of our God. *(Ps. 135:1-2)



*Thought for Today:*

We are called to Praise our Creator! Are we truly praising Him

for all that He has done? Make your job or responsibility in the

church an act of praise by doing it in reverence to Him. Honor

Him with the quality of your *work* *and the **attitude* of service

you bring to it.

* Worship the Lord and experience the joy of His blessings.*

*Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
We are called to Praise our Creator! Are we truly praising
Him for all that He has done? Make your job or
responsibility in the church an act of praise by doing it in
reverence to Him. Honor Him with the quality of your work
and the attitude of service you bring to it. Worship the
Lord and experience the joy of His blessings.
original_verse_text:
Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord! Praise Him,
you who serve in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the
house of our God.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, help us to praise You with all our hearts
in every task and responsibility, offering our work as an
act of worship and reverence. May the quality of our service
and the attitude we bring honor You and bring joy through
Your blessings. Teach us to worship You joyfully,
remembering that all we do is for Your glory. Amen. (AI)
reflection:
We are called to Praise our Creator! Are we truly praising
Him for all that He has done? Make your job or
responsibility in the church an act of praise by doing it in
reverence to Him. Honor Him with the quality of your work
and the attitude of service you bring to it. Worship the
Lord and experience the joy of His blessings.
subject: Worship the Living God
verse_text:
Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord! Praise Him,
you who serve in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the
house of our God.

*Verse for Today:*

*Give thanks to Him who alone does mighty miracles. *

*His **Faithful love endures forever. Give thanks to Him *

*who made **the heavens so skillfully. His faithful love endures forever.*

(Ps. 136:4-5)



*Thought for Today:*

The repetition of these verses should make the lesson

sink in. God’s love includes aspects of Love, kindness, mercy, and
faithfulness.
We never have to worry that

God will run out of love because it flows from a well

that will never run dry.

*God deserves our praise because His endless love *

*never fails.*

* Pastor Al*

The repetition of these verses should make the lesson sink
in. God’s love includes aspects of Love, kindness, mercy,
and faithfulness. We never have to worry that God will run
out of love because it flows from a well that will never run
dry. God deserves our praise because His endless love never
fails.

that will never run dry. Your kindness, mercy, and
faithfulness are constant, and we never have to worry that
Your love will falter. Help us to praise You always,
trusting in Your unwavering and unfailing love that sustains
us through every season. Amen. (AI)

*Verse for Today:*

*I give You thanks, O Lord, with all my heart; I will sing Your praise*

*Before the gods. *(Ps. 138:1)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Giving thanks should be an integral part of our praise to God.

This theme is woven throughout the Psalms.

As we praise and thank God for material and spiritual blessings,

we should also remember to thank Him for answered prayer.

Remember when you asked God for protection, strength, comfort,

patience, love, or other special needs, and He supplied them.

*How did you respond? **Beware of taking God’s provision **and *

*answered prayer for granted.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Giving thanks should be an integral part of our praise to
God. This theme is woven throughout the Psalms. As we praise
and thank God for material and spiritual blessings, we
should also remember to thank Him for answered prayer.
Remember when you asked God for protection, strength,
comfort, patience, love, or other special needs, and He
supplied them. How did you respond? Beware of taking God’s
provision and answered prayer for granted.
original_verse_text:
I give You thanks, O Lord, with all my heart; I will sing
Your praise Before the gods.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for Your countless blessings and
answered prayers that sustain and strengthen us each day.
Help us to never take Your provisions for granted but always
respond with hearts full of gratitude and praise. May
thanksgiving be woven into every part of our lives as a
joyful response to Your steadfast love and faithfulness.
Amen. (AI)
reflection:
Giving thanks should be an integral part of our praise to
God. This theme is woven throughout the Psalms. As we praise
and thank God for material and spiritual blessings, we
should also remember to thank Him for answered prayer.
Remember when you asked God for protection, strength,
comfort, patience, love, or other special needs, and He

provision and answered prayer for granted.
subject: Giving Thanks for Answered Prayer
verse_text:
I give You thanks, O Lord, with all my heart; I will sing
Your praise Before the gods.

*Verses for Today:*

*O Lord, You have examined my heart and know*

*everything about me. You know when I sit down*

*or stand up. *(Ps. 139:1-2)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Sometimes we don’t let people get to know us

completely, because we are afraid they will

discover something about us that they won’t

like. *But* God already knows everything about

us, even to the number of hairs on our head

(Mt. 10:30), and still He accepts and loves us.

God is with us through every situation, in every

trial—protecting, loving, and guiding.

*He knows and loves us completely.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Sometimes we don’t let people get to know us completely,
because we are afraid they will discover something about us
that they won’t like. But God already knows everything about
us, even to the number of hairs on our head (Matthew 10:30), and
still He accepts and loves us. God is with us through every
situation, in every trial—protecting, loving, and guiding.
He knows and loves us completely.
original_verse_text:
O Lord, You have examined my heart and know everything about
me. You know when I sit down or stand up.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for knowing every part of me-my
thoughts, my fears, and my hopes- better than I know myself.
Your intimate knowledge of me gives me comfort and peace,
knowing that You love me fully and guide me through every
trial. Help me to trust Your presence and care, confident
that nothing in my life is hidden from Your watchful, loving
eyes. Amen. (AI)
reflection:
Sometimes we don’t let people get to know us completely,
because we are afraid they will discover something about us
that they won’t like. But God already knows everything about
us, even to the number of hairs on our head (Matthew 10:30), and
still He accepts and loves us. God is with us through every
situation, in every trial—protecting, loving, and guiding.
He knows and loves us completely.
subject: God is All- Knowing
verse_text:
O Lord, You have examined my heart and know everything about
me. You know when I sit down or stand up.

*Subject for 9/4/19: PRAY FOR HELP WHEN FACING TEMPTATION*

(read Ps. 141)



*Verse for Today:*

*Don’t let me lust for evil things: don’t let me participate *

*in acts of wickedness. Don’t let me share in the delicacies*

*of those who do evil. *(Ps. 141:4)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Keep this in mind, evil acts begin with evil desires. It

isn’t enough to ask God to keep you away from temp-

tation—make you stronger—*or* change your circum-

stances. *You must* ask God to change you on the inside,

at the level of your desires. *We live in a world where, *

*we need to* *keep looking to Him for help.*

*Pastor Al*

isn’t enough to ask God to keep you away from temp-
stationmake you stronger—or change your circum- stances. You

looking to Him for help.

Your will. Strengthen me inwardly i resist temptation and
overcome evil desires that lead to sin. Help me to
continually seek Your grace and transformation, so I may

Subject for 9/5/19: PRAY WHEN OVERWHELMED AND DESPERATE

(read. Ps. 142)



*Verse for Today:*

*Hear my cry, for I am very low. Rescue me from my*

*persecutors, for they are to strong for me. *(Ps. 142:6)



*Thought for Today:*

Have you ever felt that no one cared what happened

to you? David had good reason to feel that way, and

he wrote, “hear my cry for I am very low.” Through

prayer, we can pull out of our tailspin *and* be reminded

that God cares for us very deeply. *When we feel*

*cornered by our enemies, only God can keep us save.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Have you ever felt that no one cared what happened to you?
David had good reason to feel that way, and he wrote, “hear
my cry for I am very low.” Through prayer, we can pull out
of our tailspin and be reminded that God cares for us very
deeply. When we feel cornered by our enemies, only God can
keep us save.
original_verse_text:
Hear my cry, for I am very low. Rescue me from my
persecutors, for they are to strong for me.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You that You know every detail of my
life and care for me deeply, even when I feel alone or
unheard. Help me to remember that You are always near, ready
to listen to my cries and protect me from all enemies. May
Your comforting presence bring peace and strength in times
of trial, reminding me that I am never forgotten or
forsaken. Amen. (AI)
reflection:
Have you ever felt that no one cared what happened to you?
David had good reason to feel that way, and he wrote, “hear
my cry for I am very low.” Through prayer, we can pull out
of our tailspin and be reminded that God cares for us very
deeply. When we feel cornered by our enemies, only God can
keep us save.
subject: Pray When Overwhelmed and Desperate
verse_text:
Hear my cry, for I am very low. Rescue me from my
persecutors, for they are to strong for me.

*Verse for Today:*

*Come quickly, Lord, and answer me, for my depression*

*deepens. Don’t turn away from me, or I will die. Let me*

*hear of Your unfailing love to me in the morning, for I*

*am trusting You. Show me where to walk, for I have *

*come to You in prayer. *(Ps. 143:6-7)



*Thoughts for Today:*

David was losing hope, caught in paralyzing fear and

deep depression. During times we too may feel like

we are caught in paralyzing fear and deep depression,

and we are unable to pull ourselves out. At those times

we can come to the Lord and, like David, express our

true feelings. Then we will find help as we remember

His works (143:5), reach out to Him in prayer (143:6),

trust Him (143:8), and seek to do His will (143:10).

*Pastor Al*

(read Ps. 144:1-7)





read Ps. 144:1-7)



*Verse for Today:*

*O Lord, what are mortals that You should notice us, mere*

*humans that You should care for us? For we are like a breath*

*of air; our days are like a passing shadow. *(Ps. 144:3-4)



*Thoughts for Today*

Life is short. David reminds us that it is “like a breath”

and that “our days are like a passing shadow.” James

says our life is “like the morning fog—it’s here a little

while, then it’s gone” (Jm. 4:14). Now because life is

short, we need to live for God while there is time. We should not waste our
life by selecting an inferior purpose

that has no lasting value. *Only God can **make your life worthwhile,
**purposeful,
and meaningful.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Life is short. David reminds us that it is “like a breath”
and that “our days are like a passing shadow.” James says
our life is “like the morning fog—it’s here a little while,
then it’s gone” (James 4:14). Now because life is short, we
need to live for God while there is time. We should not
waste our life by selecting an inferior purpose that has no
lasting value. Only God can make your life worthwhile,
purposeful, and meaningful.

original_verse_text:
O Lord, what are mortals that You should notice us, mere
humans that You should care for us? For we are like a breath
of air; our days are like a passing shadow.
prayer:
Lord, our life is indeed short, like a breath or a passing
shadow, as David and James remind us. Help us to live each
day with purpose, seeking to glorify You and not wasting
time on fleeting things. Teach us to trust in Your eternal
plan and to find lasting meaning only in Your presence. May
our lives honor You, filled with godliness and contentment,
knowing every moment is a precious gift from You. Amen. (AI)
reflection:

*Verse for Today:*

*The Lord helps the fallen and lifts up those bent*

*beneath their loads. All eyes look up to You for*

*help: You give them their food as they need it.*

(Ps. 145:14, 15)



*Thoughts to Identify With:*

Sometimes our burdens are more then we can bear,

and we wonder how we can go on. God is, able to lift

us up because (1) His greatness is beyond discovery

(145:3): (2) He does mighty acts for each generation

(145:4): (3) He is full of mighty splendor and majesty

(145:5): (4) He does awe inspiring deeds

(145:5, 6): (5) He is righteous (Ps. 145:7): (6) He is kind,

merciful, patient, and compassionate (145:8, 9):

(7) He rules over an everlasting Kingdom (145:13):

(8) He is the source of all our daily needs: (Ps. 145:15, 16):

(9) He is righteous and kind in all His dealings (145:17):

*God* *is ready to lift you up.*

* Pastor Al *

*No help for you there. *(Ps. 146:3)



*Thought for Today:*

The psalmist portrays powerful people as inadequate

saviors, making false promises they cannot deliver

(Ps. 146:3).

God is the hope and the help of the needy. Jesus

confirms His concern for the poor and afflicted in

(Lk. 4:18-21).

He does not separate the physical needs from the

spiritual needs but attends to both. *While God*

*not** the government, is the hope of the needy,*

*we are His instruments to help here on earth.*

*Pastor Al*

*Subject for 9/10/19 TAKE TIME TO LEARN MORE ABOUT GOD*

(read Ps. 147:1-6)



*Verse for Today:*

*How great is our Lord! His power is absolute!*

*His comprehension is beyond understanding! *(Ps. 147:5)



* Thought for Today:*

Sometimes we feel as if we don’t understand ourselves—

what we want, how we feel, what’s wrong with us, *or*

what we should do about it. But God’s understanding has

no limit, and therefore He understands us fully. *If *you feel

troubled and don’t understand yourself, remember that

God understands you perfectly. *So take your mind off*

*yourself and focus on God.*

*Pastor Al*

How great is our Lord! His power is absolute! His
comprehension is beyond understanding!

Lord God, Your understanding of us is limitless, for You
know every thought, every feeling, and every moment of our
lives (Psalm 139). When we feel confused or troubled, remind
us that You see us fully and love us deeply. Help us to
focus not on our doubts or fears but on Your perfect
knowledge and care, trusting in Your guiding hand. May Your
peace calm our hearts as we rest in Your unending wisdom and
grace. Amen. (AI)

*Subject for 9/11/19: PRAISE THE LORD *(read Ps. 148)



*Verse for Today:*

*Let every created thing give praise to the Lord,*

*for He issued His command, and they came *

into being. (Ps. 148:5)



*Thought for Today:*

As you read this chapter you will see the picture of

how we as believers should praise God—individually,

yet as a part of a great choir of believers worldwide.

Are you singing your part well in the worldwide choir

of praise? *Let us all do our part in the praise **of the *

*Lord.*

* Pastor Al*

as believers should praise God—individually, yet as a part
of a great choir of believers worldwide. Are you singing
your part well in the worldwide choir of praise? Let us all
do our part in the praise of the Lord.

*Subject for 9/12/19: A VICTORY CELEBRATION*

(read 149:1-9)



*Verses for Today:*

*Praise His name with dancing, accompanied by*

*tambourine and harp. For the Lord delights in His *

*people; He crowns the humble with salvation.*

Although the Bible invites us to praise God, we

often aren’t sure how to go about it. In vs. 1-9

or playing instruments. *Pick any one of these*

*and you will please the Lord.*

* Pastor Al*

*Verse for Today:*

*Let everything that lives sing praises to the Lord*

*Praise the Lord! *(Ps. 150:6)



*Thoughts for Today:*

If you feel like treasure hunting go back and review

the psalms, in doing this you will discover the parallels

of our journey through life. It begins with presenting

us two roads: the way to *life* and the way to *death*. If

we choose God’s way to *life*, we will still face both

blessings and troubles, joy and grief, success and obstacles.

But throughout it all, God is at our side, guiding, encouraging,

comforting, and caring. Knowing this should cause us to

praise God for leading us in the right direction *and for*

*assuring us of a place in the perfect world He has in *

*store for those who have faithfully followed Him. *

* Pastor Al*

of death. Help us to choose Your path, trusting in Your
presence through blessings and hardships alike. Comfort and
encourage us with the assurance of Your care and the promise
of eternal life with You. May we praise You continually for
leading us safely home. Amen. (AI)

*Subject for 9/14/19: **JUST** RETRIBUTION *

(read Esther 7:1-9)



*Verse for Today:*

“*A gallows seventy-five feet high stands by Haman’s. *

*he had it made for Mordecai…” *The King said,* “Hang *

*him on it!” *(Esther 7:9)



*Thoughts for Today:*

This Old Testament book teaches that the sin of hatred

will *not* go unpunished. History alone has made that clear.

*Not* hatred but love—to God and to others—is to be a

part our daily lives. We are enabled to love because God

first loved us. To prove that love God sent His own Son to

Atone for our sins and to prepare the way for us to follow

Him to eternal life. *Ask God for an outpouring of love *

*Into your heart for others.*

* Pastor Al*

daily lives. We are enabled to love because God first loved

sins and to prepare the way for us to follow Him to eternal

others.

“A gallows seventy-five feet high stands by Haman’s. he had
it made for Mordecai…” The King said, "Hang him on it!"
prayer:
Lord God, help us to reject hatred and embrace love as You
have commanded. May Your love, which sent Your Son to atone
for our sins, fill our hearts and overflow to others. Teach
us to love as Paul described-protecting, trusting, hoping,
and persevering—so that we reflect Your grace in all we do.
Amen. (AI)

*Verse for Today:*

*Will not God bring about justice for His chosen ones,*

*who cry out to Him day and night? *(Lk. 18:7)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Scripture asks us to pray diligently. Ro. 12:12 says:

*“Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction, faithful in*

*prayer.” * *So the question is*: *what does it mean to*

*pray without ceasing?* Really What does *God* want

us to do? Well God has given us work to do. As well

as rest periods. To pray unceasingly means to be

diligent in prayer. Morning prayers, evening prayers,

table prayers, and prayers in special circumstances,

this adds up to the diligence God wants. Many are

the inducements for praying faithfully, *especially *

the invitation of Christ to come to Him with our

burdens, lay them on Him, and find rest for our

souls. *Our Lord does provide for our needs, for *

*He Himself is our rest, and our peace.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Scripture asks us to pray diligently. Romans 12:12 says: “Be
joyful in hope, patient in affliction, faithful in prayer.”
So the question is: what does it mean to pray without
ceasing? Really What does God want us to do? Well God has
given us work to do. As well as rest periods. To pray
unceasingly means to be diligent in prayer. Morning prayers,
evening prayers, table prayers, and prayers in special
circumstances, this adds up to the diligence God wants. Many
are the inducements for praying faithfully, especially the
invitation of Christ to come to Him with our burdens, lay
them on Him, and find rest for our souls. Our Lord does
provide for our needs, for He Himself is our rest, and our
peace.
original_verse_text:
Will not God bring about justice for His chosen ones, who
cry out to Him day and night?
prayer:
Lord Jesus, teach us to pray without ceasing—not by being in
constant verbal prayer, but by having hearts continually
dependent on You and aware of Your presence throughout the
day. Help us to bring our burdens, joys, and needs to You
often, trusting Your invitation to find rest for our souls.
Strengthen us to be diligent in prayer, knowing it connects
us to Your peace and provision. May prayer be our first
response in every circumstance, keeping us faithful and
close to You at all times. Amen. (Al)
reflection:
Scripture asks us to pray diligently. Romans 12:12 says: “Be

*Verses for Today: *

*It is by grace you have been saved. *(Eph. 2:8)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Here is a thought that passes our understanding. It has

to do with our relationship between God’s universal

grace—the fact that God wants all people to be saved

(I Tim. 2:4)—and salvation by God’s grace alone. If God

predestines and gives the power to believe, why doesn’t

He do this for all? Perhaps in eternity we will understand.

In the mean-time let us faithfully adhere to the truths of

salvation God has revealed in His Word. Let us remember

we are all sinners, incapable of self-salvation. To save us,

God sent His Son to redeem us, and He continues to send

His Holy Spirit to create and confirm faith in us. *How *

*thankful we should be for the work God has performed *

*in us and through us proclaims it to others.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Here is a thought that passes our understanding. It has to
do with our relationship between God’s universal grace—the
fact that God wants all people to be saved (I Timothy 2:4)—and
salvation by God’s grace alone. If God predestines and gives

Perhaps in eternity we will understand. In the meantime let
us faithfully adhere to the truths of salvation God has
revealed in His Word. Let us remember we are all sinners,
incapable of self-salvation. To save us, God sent His Son to
redeem us, and He continues to send His Holy Spirit to
create and confirm faith in us. How thankful we should be
for the work God has performed in us and through us
proclaims it to others.
original_verse_text: It is by grace you have been saved.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for Your amazing grace that calls
all people to salvation through Jesus Christ. We acknowledge
that only by Your Spirit's work are we awakened to faith and
drawn into a saving relationship with You. Help us to trust
fully in Your revealed truths, even when mysteries remain
beyond our understanding. May Your Holy Spirit continue to
create and strengthen our faith, guiding our lives to
proclaim Your saving love to others. Amen. (AI)

*Verse for Today:*

*Whoever lives by the truth comes into the light, so that *

*it may be seen plainly that what he has done has been *

*done through God.* (Jn. 2:21)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Jesus came to be the light of the world. He spoke the

truth of God’s Word as it sheds light on sinfulness and

the truth of God’s grace. All we have to do is have faith

in Christ as the one and only Savior. Faith brings forgiveness,

peace with God, light to guide us day by day, and everlasting

life. Now all God’s people can stand in the light of God’s

Word. Believers have nothing to hide, there is no need to

be secretive, no need to sit in darkness while it is day.

*Ask God to let you bask in the sunshine of His love in Christ.*

* Pastor Al*

darkness and gives us the light of life. Help us to walk

with Your truth and grace. Fill our hearts with Your peace,
so we have nothing to hide but live openly in the joy of
Your love. May Your light shine through us to draw others to
Your saving presence. Amen. (Al)

*Verse for Today:*

*The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it, the world, *

*and all that lives in it*. (Ps. 24:1)



*Thoughts for Today:*

God desires that we be faithful and thoughtful stewards

of* all* His creation. *Also* belonging to God as His precious

possessions are the people inhabiting the earth. Christians

recognize God’s ownership of them as His people. He has

not only made them He has redeemed them. *“You are not*

*your own. You were bought with a price”* (I Cor.6:19-20).

St. Peter told us what that price was: *“The Precious blood *

*of Christ, a lamb without blemish or defect” *(I Pet. 1:19).

*God is our Landlord; we are mere renters, tenants, stewards.*

* Pastor Al*

message_id: 16d46ebaf56af603
subject   : Subject for 9/19/19: HATRED AND MURDER: THE ONLY CURE
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 18 Sep 2019 19:28:34 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

(read Ro. 13:8-14)



*Verse for Today:*

*Love does no harm to its neighbor. Therefore love is*

*The fulfillment of the law. *(Ro. 13:10)



*Thought for Today:*

Killing is an old sin. Remember the story of Cain and Abel?

Cain killed his brother out of jealousy. There is only one way

to overcome hatred and what it can lead to, *and that is* to

become a new person in Christ, to be clothed with Him and

to have Him in your heart by faith in His saving merit. Faith

gives way to love for the neighbor, even for one who sins against us. In I
Cor. 13:7 Paul declared that love “*always protects, always **trusts,
always hopes, always perseveres*.”

*The next time we **make a claim about our love let us remember Paul’s
definition **of love.*

* Pastor Al*

Your love. Clothe us in Your grace that we may forgive those

subject   : Subject for 9/20/19: STRENGTH AMID WEAKNESS (read 2 Cor. 12:1-10)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 19 Sep 2019 19:23:56 -0500

*Verse for Today:*

*When I am weak, then I am strong. *(2 Cor. 12:10)



*Thoughts for Today:*

By faith many Christians have experienced this to be true.

Heb. 11 is a detailed report on what God’s people

accomplished because they trusted in God. Despite

human weakness, they prevailed in very difficult

circumstances. God’s strength is still ours. In fact,

the more we let God take over when we have problems,

the more we succeed. When it comes to salvation, we

depend entirely on God. St. Paul’s words are an appropriate

theme for our lives: *When we rely on Christ, we are truly*

*strong.*

* Pastor Al*

Lord God, as Hebrews 11 reminds us, faith is the confident
assurance in what we hope for and the conviction of things
not seen. Through faith, Your people from ages past, such as
Abraham, Moses, and Rahab, overcame trials, obeyed Your
call, and gained victory despite their human weaknesses.
Their example encourages us that relying entirely on Your
strength leads to true success and perseverance in difficult
circumstances. Help us to trust You fully in our salvation
and daily lives, knowing that when we depend on Christ, we
are truly strong. Amen. (AI)

*Verse for Today:*

*Rule over the fish of the sea and the birds of the air*

*and over every living creature that moves on the *

*ground. *(Gen 1:28)



*Thoughts for Today:*

God’s commission to our first parents is still in effect.

We, their descendants, are still to exercise a wise

dominion over all nature.

Beyond good stewardship of our natural resources,

God calls us to an even greater responsibility and

privilege, that is to be witnesses to all the world

concerning His saving love in Christ Jesus, His Son

and our only Savior. *[What a joy and privilege.]*

* Pastor Al*

message_id: 16d559d3514dcce1
subject   : Subject for 9/22/19: OUR WORST ENEMY IS OVERCOME (read Rev. 12:7-12)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 21 Sep 2019 15:57:09 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Verse for Today:*

*The great dragon was hurled down—that ancient serpent*

*called the devil, who leads the whole world astray. *(Rev. 12:9)



*Thoughts for Today:*

In my human reasoning, I believe Satan struck in the Garden

of Eden first to get even with God for throwing him out of

heaven. For this he became an avid enemy of God, he could

not avenge himself on the Lord. So Satan turn to Adam and

Eve, the very crown of creation whom God had made in His

own image. As we all know he hasn’t quit yet: “the whole

world is under the control of the evil one” (I Jn. 5:19). Take

note of this, *the world is given over to all the fruits of the *

*flesh:* “sexual immorality, impurity and debauchery; idolatry

and witchcraft; hatred, discord, jealousy, fits of rage, selfish

ambition, dissension, factions and envy; drunkenness, orgies,

and the like” (Gal. 5:19-21). All the while Satan tempts people

to the *greatest* sin of all—UNBELIEF. *BUT CHRIST PAID IT ALL*

*ON THE CROSS.*

* Pastor Al *

all—UNBELIEF. BUT CHRIST PAID IT ALL ON THE CROSS.

prayer:
Lord God, we acknowledge that Satan, once an angel created
by You, became prideful and rebelled against Your authority.
His rebellion began before the fall of humanity and led to
his expulsion from heaven. Unable to take vengeance on You,
he turned his hatred toward Adam and Eve, the crown of Your
creation made in Your image. Through deceit and temptation
in the Garden of Eden, Satan introduced sin into the world,
and ever since, "the whole world is under the control of the
evil one" (1 John 5:19). Protect us from the fruits of the
flesh and the greatest sin of unbelief. Thank You, Lord
Jesus, for paying it all on the cross and conquering sin and
Satan. Strengthen our faith to remain steadfast in Your
grace and truth. Amen. (AI)

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Sun, 22 Sep 2019 19:33:04 -0500

*Verse for Today:*
*What good is it for a man to gain the whole world,*
*yet forfeit his soul? *(Mk. 8:36)

*Thoughts for Today:*
Let us remember that when we acknowledge Christ as
Lord and Savior, He enriches us with the greatest treasure---
*salvation.* Which He earned for us by His death as the sacrificial
Lamb of God. In the light of Christ's love for us, and by the
strength of faith that the Holy Spirit gives in Baptism and sustains
in Communion, we can make the right choices. Let us have the
mind of Joshua who said in chapter 24:15, *"As for me and my household, we
will serve the Lord." *Let us always ask,
*[How can I best serve the Lord?]*
*Pastor Al *

message_id: 16d60fca9f8d55df
subject   : Subject for 9/24/19: INFLUENCE OTHERS FOR GOOD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 23 Sep 2019 20:57:14 -0500
===================================================================

*Verse for Today:*
*"I have set you an example that you should do as*
*I have done for you. *(Jn. 13:15)

*Thoughts for Today:*
Sometime people are misled by those they respect. All
Christians need to be on guard, so that they don't mislead
children or those weak in the faith so they sin. Jesus has
sharp words for those who cause *"One of these little ones*
*who believe in Me to sin*" (Mt. 18:6). How good it is, when
Christians help someone grow in faith and understanding.
Its like when parents bring up their children "In the
training and instruction of the Lord" (Eph. 6:4).* Remember*
such instruction is often given by example; attitudes are
caught rather than taught. *We have the greatest example*
*In Jesus when it comes to serving others.*
* Pastor Al*

Lord Jesus, You warn us with sharp words about the
seriousness of causing "one of these little ones who believe
in Me to sin" (Matthew 18:6). These "little ones" are all

faith. We pray for protection for them, that they may grow
strong in faith and be shielded from sin and false teaching.

original_content:
message_id: 16d65e73ab052154
subject   : Subject for 9/25/19: GOD AT WORK THROUGH THE WORD (Mk. 4:26-29)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 24 Sep 2019 19:51:56 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Verse for Today:*

*The seed sprouts and grows, … first the stalk, then the head,*

*Then the full kernel in the head*. (Mk. 4:27-28)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Seeds contain enormous power. Sown into the ground

these little “workers” take of their jackets and get busy.

New plants emerge and mature. We can prepare the

soil, fertilize it, irrigate, and sow the seeds. *But* that is

all we can do. We cannot put the germinating power

into the seed itself. That is the way it is with the Word

of God, the Gospel of Jesus Christ. As Christians we

proclaim it in our neighborhoods and to the world at large.

We prepare ourselves, speak words people can understand,

use the media at our disposal, and the like. *But *there is a

limit to what we can do. When it comes to producing

results in people—creating the saving, heart changing

faith—we can do nothing at all. *“No man can redeem the *

*l**ife of another or **give God a ransom for him” *(Ps. 49:7).

The Gospel has wonderful Power *“* *for the salvation of *

*everyone who believes”* (Ro. 1:16). *It is the Triune **God *

*who effects our salvation.*

* Pastor Al*

it, irrigate, and sow the seeds. But that is all we can do.

we can do. When it comes to producing results in
people—creating the saving, heart changing faith—we can do
nothing at all. “No man can redeem the life of another or
give God a ransom for him” (Psalm 49:7). The Gospel has
wonderful Power “ for the salvation of everyone who
believes” (Romans 1:16). It is the Triune God who effects our
salvation.

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Wed, 25 Sep 2019 19:21:12 -0500

*Verse for Today:*

*You have heard of Job’s perseverance and have heard*

*Of what the Lord finally brought about. *(Jm. 5:11)



*Thoughts for Today:*

It is had to imagine how Job, a pious man, could endure

the staggering losses he suffered. Losses were his oxen,

sheep, camels, family, and health. How did Job react? He

said, “The Lord gave and the Lord has taken away; may

the name of the Lord be praised: (Job. 1:21). Job is an

example to us. His unwavering faith led him to celebrate

Easter and the Resurrection long before Jesus came into

the world, because he confessed, “I Know that my

redeemer lives, and that in the end He will stand upon

the earth. And after my skin has been destroyed, yet in

my flesh I will see God; I myself will see Him with my eyes—

I, and not another” (Job. 19:25-27).

*May God grant you steadfast faith amid suffering.*

* Pastor Al*

reflection: It is had to imagine how Job, a pious man, could endure the staggering losses he suffered. Losses were his oxen, sheep, camels, family, and health. How did Job react? He said, “The Lord gave and the Lord has taken away; may the name of the Lord be praised: (Job. 1:21). Job is an example to us. His unwavering faith led him to celebrate Easter and the Resurrection long before Jesus came into the world, because he confessed, “I Know that my redeemer lives, and that in the end He will stand upon the earth. And after my skin has been destroyed, yet in my flesh I will see God; I myself will see Him with my eyes— I, and not another” (Job.19:25-27). May God grant you steadfast faith amid suffering.
subject: Steadfastness Amid Suffering
verse_text:
You have heard of Job’s perseverance and have heard Of what
the Lord finally brought about.

*Verse for Today:*

*They called Rebekah and asked her, “Will you go*

*with this man?” “I will go,” she said. *(Gen. 24:58)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Our Lord leads us in the right direction. He, conceived

by the Holy Spirit and born of the Virgin Mary, declares,

“What God has joined together, let man not separate”

(Mt. 19:6). God guides us, urging us to do His will. Husbands

and wives, lovingly and serving one another, are a portrait

of Christ loving the church and giving up His life for her.

Let us pray that God, for Jesus sake, may help us to always

Regard marriage as honorable.

* No marriage so honored is accidental.*

* Pastor Al*

the Virgin Mary, You teach us that what God has joined
together, no one should separate (Matthew 19:6). Help

subject   : Subject for (9/28/19) UNBELIEF, A STOPPER (read Mk. 6:1-6)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 27 Sep 2019 19:42:26 -0500
===================================================================

*Verse for Today:*

*Jesus could not do any mighty works. … He marveled *

*Because of their unbelief. *(Mk. 6:5, 6)



*Thoughts for Today:*

When celebrities come home, their communities often

welcome and honor them. Not so with Nazareth and

Jesus. Why was that? The reason for shutting the door

to Jesus was unbelief. They went so far as to try and

throw Him off a cliff in order to kill Him. There is no

greater barrier to the work of Jesus Christ than unbelief.

Remember Jesus Christ works by love. He witnesses

to the love of God that does not abandon sinners but

pleads with them to accept Him in faith and thus obtain

the salvation He procured. *He wants to come in and*

*share with us the gifts He brings*

* Pastor Al*

prayer:
Lord Jesus, we see how Your own hometown rejected You
because of unbelief, shutting the door to Your invitation of
love and salvation. Yet, Your love never ceases to call us,
pleading with sinners to turn to You in faith. Help us to
open our hearts without hesitation, trusting in Your mercy
and grace. May we receive You as our Friend and Savior,
welcoming the gifts You bring that transform and save.
Strengthen our faith so that unbelief will no longer be a
barrier to Your work in our lives. Amen. (AI)

subject   : Subject for 9/29/19: THE GUARDIAN ANGELS (read Ps. 91)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Sat, 28 Sep 2019 18:58:52 -0500

*Verse For Today:*

*[God] will command His angels concerning you to guard you *

*in all your ways. *(Ps. 91:11)



*Thoughts for Today:*

Much has been said about and written about angels. There

are book, songs, movies and even web sites. When the

Psalmist declares that angels attend us in all our ways, the understanding is
that we have their coverage as we discharge our God-pleasing, Christian
vocation. The promise *does not* extend to activities that are sinful or
that put God to the test.

When Satan tempted Jesus to leap from the highest point of

the temple, he quoted this psalm *but* left out some important

words. Our Lord refused to yield to this temptation, for He

knew the omitted phrase “in all your ways” *did not* assure

Him of angelic protection for such a foolish act. *The function *

*of angels is threefold: to praise God **to carry out his commands* *and
to serve mankind.*

*Pastor Al*

prayer:
Lord God, we thank You for the promise in Psalm 91 that You
command Your angels to protect us in all our ways. Help us
to live in Your will and not test Your mighty protection
with foolishness. May we walk faithfully in Your path,
trusting that Your angels attend to us, carrying us safely
as we serve You. Give us humility to follow Jesus' example
by not forcing Your hand but resting in Your gentle care.
May we praise You for Your faithful provision through Your
angels and Your abiding presence. Amen. (AI)

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

*Verse for Today:*

*“You know the way to the place where I am going. . . .*

*I am the Way and the Truth and the Life.” *(Jn. 14:4, 6)



*Thoughts for To Day:*

In vs. 5 Peter should have known the answer to his

question “how do we know the way?” But he wasn’t

100% sure. Because of the answer he received the

all Important point is now clear to us. We now know

where we are going and we know the Way. In this

reading Jesus prepares His disciples for His departure.

He was returning to His Heavenly Father, but they

were to travel on to be His witnesses in the world.

Jesus is the one and only Son of the Father, and the

one and only Way to Him. *He* *reconciled us to God *

*by bearing our sins to Calvary’s cross and leaving *

*them there.*

* Pastor Al *

prayer:
Lord Jesus, You are the Way, the Truth, and the Life. When
Peter asked how to know the way, You revealed that You alone
are that Way. You reconcile us to God by bearing our sins on
the cross, opening the path to the Father. As Your
disciples, help us to follow You faithfully, knowing there
is no other path to salvation but through Your sacrifice and
resurrection. May we be confident in this truth and boldly
witness to others about the hope we have in You. Amen. (AI)

*Verse for Today:*

*The Word became flesh and made His dwelling among us. . . **Full of grace
and truth. *(Jn. 1:14)



*Thoughts for Today:*

In the realm of spiritual beliefs, truth is even more precious. God reveals
His truth abundantly in His

Word and He broadcasts it in the Gospel of Jesus

Christ. But people are preoccupied with self-centered pursuits. They have
not tuned in. Both their reception

and their perception leave much to be desired.

*Because this has been true since the fall into sin,*

*God sent His truth to earth in the person of Jesus Christ.*

* Pastor Al*

much to be desired. Because this has been true since the
fall into sin, God sent His truth to earth in the person of
Jesus Christ.

Full of grace and truth.
prayer:
Lord God, Your truth is precious and abundant, revealed
fully in Your Word and supremely in the Gospel of Jesus
Christ. Yet, many are distracted by self-centered pursuits
and fail to receive or perceive this truth. Since the fall
into sin, You sent Jesus to be the living Word, the perfect
revelation of Your love and grace, so that we might know and
follow You rightly. Help us to tune our hearts and minds to
Your truth and to live by it faithfully every day. Amen.
